NAME: Madhuri Jain
ABOUT:
For a quick-start, I would simply mention Java Technology as my best friend who's with me since my school days. I have been working with Java for almost a decade especially pertaining to it's utility for back-end purpose.
To add more, I'm a passionate CS engineer who's always on for:
•	Software Development with respect to both :
                             - Application Software (Web or Stand-alone, exploring my ways through)
                             - System Software (I would love to have my hands-on)
•	Operating Systems and Computer Architecture (music to my ears, lot to learn)
•	Database Management (omnipresent)
•	Embedded and Real Time Systems (alien to me, hence adventurous)
•	Robotics (that gives a true feel of engineering)
•	And lots of never-ending learning and coding...
It feels great to see my lifeless program turning into a live, running and jumping process! :D

and in leisure times-
Traits of a geek like reading and learning to excel in the technical jargon, exercise team spirit via management and participation in various sports and stage events, choreography and confidence building etc.

- Never learnt to give up and would always give my 100% in whatever job I do
- Life-long challenge is to expand the scale of my 100%
- I'm a hard-core CSE person, so it's always either 0 or 1 :)

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Replica Determinism in Distributed Real time Systems
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
Technology : C++ and Java
My main task was to design a device driver for a Multiprocessor Link Interface for Infineon Tricore 1796 Microcontroller using the PXROS real-time operating system as the platform.The major goal was to enhance fault tolerance of the system by removing the problems of hardware replica determinism, i.e., consistent replicas in the absence of failures.
